channel.title: Can I run a server through port 5555 rather than 43594?
channel.description: I called my ISP and they said that I cannot use 43594 because they have it dedicated, so I checker 5555 and it is open, so can I use 5555 rather than 43594? If I can how do I change to 5555 from 43594, which file do I need to edit? Thanks!!

item.title: Can I run a server through port 5555 rather than 43594?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

deathschaos9:

The server port is probably in server.java or server.ini, you’ll also have to change the port in the client, normally client.java.

And if you need to change the IP to your local address, look in EGUI/Gui/client and look for serverip or setserver or something similar.

Read full topic
item.source: Can I run a server through port 5555 rather than 43594?

item.title: Can I run a server through port 5555 rather than 43594?

@Microsoft11 wrote:

Any other Ideas? -_-

item.title: Can I run a server through port 5555 rather than 43594?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

If you’re the hosting computer than you connect with your local address (localhost, 0.0.0.0, 127.0.0.1)

item.title: Can I run a server through port 5555 rather than 43594?
item.dc:creator: @Microsoft11 Microsoft1
item.description:
@Microsoft11 wrote:

Alright, I went to check if my server was online, I have Duc running I have the source running, I have it on Port 5555, I tested and it says it is still offline…

Do I need to change anything else in the files so that it knows to work with my Ip address?? Like Put somthing in there that says “184.8.***.72” I thought I had to do that a few years back, but I am just starting and I totally forget…

Read full topic
item.source: Can I run a server through port 5555 rather than 43594?

item.title: Can I run a server through port 5555 rather than 43594?
item.dc:creator: @Mercifies Mercifies
item.description:
@Mercifies wrote:

Lookup

setserver("

In both Server.java and client.java to change the port. For me, server.java was defective so I changed the port in client.java and it worked.

Read full topic
